title.narrative: IMPACT TIP-TAN: Improving Prosecution and Capacity

description.narrative: Lawyers Without Borders (LWOB) is improving human trafficking investigations and prosecutions in Tanzania through detail-focused, capacity building and training and materials for criminal justice actors and complementary community and NGO work. LWOB's program focuses on victim-centered investigations and prosecutions of human trafficking cases, developing tools and curricula that generate a tailored-to-Tanzania approach of law enforcement, prosecutors, judges, and magistrates to collaborate and coordinate to improve prosecutions.

title.narrative: Restoration of the 19th-Century Bwanga House in Pangani

description.narrative: To support the restoration of Bwanga House, a 19th-century Indian shop house in Pangani notable for its distinctive architecture. Though the original structure remains largely intact, it is deteriorating and urgently requires restoration. The project involves training for local craftsmen in traditional building techniques, restoration of the shop house, and the outfitting of a display space for traditional crafts.

title.narrative: Establishment of a national data collection system in Tanzania

description.narrative: The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) seeks to enhance collaborative methods and improve capacity to combat human trafficking in Southern Africa by establishing a harmonized TIP data collection and reporting system. UNODC will roll out a data collection and reporting system in Tanzania. This will include setting up a national data hub, linked to the UNODC-SADC regional data hub, as well as conducting trainings for users of the system.

title.narrative: Strengthening and Sustaining Tanzania's Response to Trafficking in Persons, Ensuring Access to Justice and Fair Treatment for Trafficking in Persons (TIP) Victims

description.narrative: RTI International seeks to strengthen the national criminal justice system's response to trafficking in persons and ensure access to justice and fair treatment for all TIP victims. In doing this, RTI International will conduct a review of current laws and TIP regulations in Tanzania to strengthen the legal framework, strengthen national coordination through the development of SOPs/internal procedures for key ministries that set specific roles and provide instructions for implementing duties, develop a victim identification and referral mechanism, and build institutional capacity to prosecute TIP cases through case consultation.
